title: JOEY JORDISON's Family Launches Kickstarter To Finally Release His VIMIC Record
description: All hail Joey. The post JOEY JORDISON's Family Launches Kickstarter To Finally Release His VIMIC Record appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 8 hours ago
text: The story of Vimic is a pretty tragic one. It all started after Joey Jordison was fired from Slipknot in 2013. Jordison went on to launch a few new projects, one of which was Vimic – a band featuring Jordison, Kalen Chase on vocals, Jed Simon and Kris Norris on guitar, Kyle Konkiel on bass, and Matthew Tarach on keyboards. Vimic released their first single "Simple Skeletons" on May 6, 2016, followed by a second single "She Sees Everything" on May 16 and a third called "My Fate" on June 3. Norris eventually left the band, Steve Marshall joined, and Vimic was set to release their debut album Open Your Omen in 2019. Then Open Your Omen producer Kato Khandwala died in 2018, everyone else in the band got busy, and Jordison died in 2021. Now all these years later and Jordison's family has finally posted a Kickstarter to get the Vimic record out into the world. The Kickstarter is available here, though it only says it's going to be "launched soon." So keep an eye out! "After years of working to secure the rights to the music, the Jordison Family Estate is releasing Open Your Omen independently to get the album into the hands of the fans that have been asking for it for years," reads a description on the Kickstarter. "Joey didn't do anything small. We want to release this album the way he would have wanted; with the designs he was so actively involved with creating for the CD, double LP, merch, and with the support of his fans to make the biggest splash we can upon release. "We have added personal items of Joey's to help raise the money needed to manufacture and distribute physical product, market the album, and host a night to remember as VIMIC reunites to perform an event honoring Joey's legacy." html:
The story of Vimic is a pretty tragic one.

It all started after Joey Jordison was fired from Slipknot in 2013. Jordison went on to launch a few new projects, one of which was Vimic – a band featuring Jordison, Kalen Chase on vocals, Jed Simon and Kris Norris on guitar, Kyle Konkiel on bass, and Matthew Tarach on keyboards.

Vimic released their first single "Simple Skeletons" on May 6, 2016, followed by a second single "She Sees Everything" on May 16 and a third called "My Fate" on June 3. Norris eventually left the band, Steve Marshall joined, and Vimic was set to release their debut album Open Your Omen in 2019.

Then Open Your Omen producer Kato Khandwala died in 2018, everyone else in the band got busy, and Jordison died in 2021. Now all these years later and Jordison's family has finally posted a Kickstarter to get the Vimic record out into the world.

The Kickstarter is available here, though it only says it's going to be "launched soon." So keep an eye out!

"After years of working to secure the rights to the music, the Jordison Family Estate is releasing Open Your Omen independently to get the album into the hands of the fans that have been asking for it for years," reads a description on the Kickstarter.

"Joey didn't do anything small. We want to release this album the way he would have wanted; with the designs he was so actively involved with creating for the CD, double LP, merch, and with the support of his fans to make the biggest splash we can upon release.

"We have added personal items of Joey's to help raise the money needed to manufacture and distribute physical product, market the album, and host a night to remember as VIMIC reunites to perform an event honoring Joey's legacy."
